intro: Lathyrus niger f. longipes, commonly known as the black vetch or long-stemmed black vetch, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its dark purple to black flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces elongated, slender pods that contain small, dark seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas.
